title: A Hope For Home - Complete Discography
description:
I've known about this band for a while now, and I believe that they are one of the most underrated post-hardcore bands out there. I really love how each of their albums have progressively changed, yet they all sound amazing on their own.



[2007] Here, The End (~273kbps)

01 Casting Light Through Such Thin Shades
02 The Residuum
03 (Grace) We Are The Heirs!
04 Verily I Say, Unto You
05 Of Water And The Spirit
06 My Path, Ascending
07 Kyle
08 If, And Only If
09 The Human Project Lives
10 Yea, The Cold Embrace Of The Sea
11 Here, The End


 
[2009] The Everlasting Man (320kbps)

01 The Covenant
02 Iniquity: An Offering
03 Affliction: The Witness, The Advocate
04 Infidelity: Kingdom's End
05 The Exile
06 Babylon: The Insatiable Thirst
07 Absolution: Of Flight and Failure
08 Masada: The Spiral Staircase
09 Restoration: The Return From Exile
10 Redemption: A Grief Observed
11 The Thousand Years



[2010] Realis (320kbps)

01 Nightfall
02 The Overman
03 Withering Branches
04 The Machine Stops
05 No Light
06 Post Tenebras Lux
07 First Light Of Dawn
08 The Crippling Fear
09 The Warmth Of The Heavens
10 Seasons
11 Ascension
12 After



[2011] In Abstraction (320kbps)

01 Calm
02 Out Of Ruin, Misery
03 Firewind
04 Tides
05 The House Where You Were Born
06 Weaved
07 Everything That Rises Must Converge



A Hope for Home (commonly abbreviated to AHFH) is a band based in Portland, Oregon that formed in 2006. They have 3 studio albums, two of which were released on Facedown Records and Strike First (the imprint label of Facedown Records). Throughout their career, A Hope for Home has controlled many of the aspects of their music including the recording, production, mixing, art direction, and art design. These commitments have allowed them to achieve the precise sound and imagery of their intentions, and have become part of the bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s dynamic. 




P.S. 
I've also included the bonus DVD from the album In Abstraction. You can find the trailer on YT if you're interested in watching it. I recommend you do after listening to the album.

Enjoy!
